title: Electricity
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Electricity** is one of the rarer elemental forces in the Dungeon. Both players and monsters can take advantage of electricity through spells or specially [branded](/Brand "Brand") weapons, though some monsters also possess innate electric abilities.

## Contents

- [1 Electricity Damage](#Electricity_Damage)
- [2 Electricity Resistance](#Electricity_Resistance)
  - [2.1 Vulnerability](#Vulnerability)
- [3 See Also](#See_Also)
- [4 History](#History)

## Electricity Damage

The player has a lot of ways to inflict electricity damage: weapons, spells, god abilities, and an [evocable](/Evocable "Evocable") item. Also, [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form") adds electricity damage to your [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat") attacks.

Several [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") spells deal electric damage, while weapons of [electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") have a flat chance to inflict extra damage regardless of your weapon skill. A [lightning rod](/Lightning_rod "Lightning rod") is another common source of electric damage. Followers of [Nemelex](/Nemelex "Nemelex") can create electrical explosions by drawing the [Storm card](/Storm_card "Storm card"), and followers of [Qazlal](/Qazlal "Qazlal") have access to Upheaval and Disaster Area abilities.

"BEAM\_ELEC" damage, comprising most (but not all) electric attacks, ignores 1/2 of the target's [AC](/AC "AC").

## Electricity Resistance

Electricity resistance reduces electric damage by 66% (to x33%).

It can be acquired from a number of sources:

**Item:**

- [Staff of air](/Staff_of_air "Staff of air")
- [Storm dragon scales](/Storm_dragon_scales "Storm dragon scales")
- [Potion of resistance](/Potion_of_resistance "Potion of resistance") (temporary)
- Various [randarts](/Randart "Randart") and [unrands](/Unrand "Unrand")

**Character:**

- Black [Draconians](/Draconian "Draconian") and [Gargoyles](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") have innate rElec.
- [Electricity Resistance](/Good_mutations#Electricity_Resistance "Good mutations") [mutation](/Mutation "Mutation")
- The [demonspawn mutation](/Demonspawn_mutation "Demonspawn mutation"), [Thin Metallic Scales](/Good_mutations#Thin_Metallic_Scales "Good mutations") 3
- [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form") and [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form")

### Vulnerability

Electric vulnerability increases electric damage taken by +50%.

It can be given as part of [Qazlal](/Qazlal "Qazlal")'s [wrath](/Divine_retribution "Divine retribution"), but is not found anywhere else. No monsters are vulnerable to electric damage.

## See Also

[List of electricity resistant monsters](/Category:Electricity_resistance "Category:Electricity resistance")

## History

- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), rElec reduced damage by 75%.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), the [electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") brand would spread electricity through [shallow water](/Shallow_water "Shallow water"), dealing damage to nearby creatures standing in water.
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), being airborne gave immunity to the [electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") brand and resistance to [Static Discharge](/Static_Discharge "Static Discharge").
html:
Electricity

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Electricity is one of the rarer elemental forces in the Dungeon. Both players and monsters can take advantage of electricity through spells or specially branded weapons, though some monsters also possess innate electric abilities.

Contents

  • 1 Electricity Damage
  • 2 Electricity Resistance
    • 2.1 Vulnerability
  • 3 See Also
  • 4 History

Electricity Damage

The player has a lot of ways to inflict electricity damage: weapons, spells, god abilities, and an evocable item. Also, Storm Form adds electricity damage to your Unarmed Combat attacks.

Several Air Magic spells deal electric damage, while weapons of electrocution have a flat chance to inflict extra damage regardless of your weapon skill. A lightning rod is another common source of electric damage. Followers of Nemelex can create electrical explosions by drawing the Storm card, and followers of Qazlal have access to Upheaval and Disaster Area abilities.

"BEAM_ELEC" damage, comprising most (but not all) electric attacks, ignores 1/2 of the target's AC.

Electricity Resistance

Electricity resistance reduces electric damage by 66% (to x33%).

It can be acquired from a number of sources:

Item:

  • Staff of air
  • Storm dragon scales
  • Potion of resistance (temporary)
  • Various randarts and unrands

Character:

  • Black Draconians and Gargoyles have innate rElec.
  • Electricity Resistance mutation
  • The demonspawn mutation, Thin Metallic Scales 3
  • Statue Form and Storm Form

Vulnerability

Electric vulnerability increases electric damage taken by +50%.

It can be given as part of Qazlal's wrath, but is not found anywhere else. No monsters are vulnerable to electric damage.

See Also

List of electricity resistant monsters

History

  • Prior to 0.18, rElec reduced damage by 75%.
  • Prior to 0.14, the electrocution brand would spread electricity through shallow water, dealing damage to nearby creatures standing in water.
  • Prior to 0.13, being airborne gave immunity to the electrocution brand and resistance to Static Discharge.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Electricity&oldid=74985"

rawPage:
{{version030}}
'''Electricity''' is one of the rarer elemental forces in the Dungeon. Both players and monsters can take advantage of electricity through spells or specially [[brand]]ed weapons, though some monsters also possess innate electric abilities.

==Electricity Damage==
The player has a lot of ways to inflict electricity damage: weapons, spells, god abilities, and an [[evocable]] item. Also, [[Storm Form]] adds electricity damage to your [[Unarmed Combat]] attacks.

Several [[Air Magic]] spells deal electric damage, while weapons of [[electrocution]] have a flat chance to inflict extra damage regardless of your weapon skill. A [[lightning rod]] is another common source of electric damage. Followers of [[Nemelex]] can create electrical explosions by drawing the [[Storm card]], and followers of [[Qazlal]] have access to Upheaval and Disaster Area abilities.

"BEAM_ELEC" damage, comprising most (but not all) electric attacks, ignores 1/2 of the target's [[AC]].

==Electricity Resistance==
Electricity resistance reduces electric damage by 66% (to x33%). 

It can be acquired from a number of sources:

'''Item:'''
*[[Staff of air]]
*[[Storm dragon scales]]
*[[Potion of resistance]] (temporary)
*Various [[randart]]s and [[unrand]]s

'''Character:'''
*Black [[Draconian]]s and [[Gargoyle]]s have innate rElec.
*[[Good mutations#Electricity Resistance|Electricity Resistance]] [[mutation]]
*The [[demonspawn mutation]], [[Good mutations#Thin Metallic Scales|Thin Metallic Scales]] 3
*[[Statue Form]] and [[Storm Form]]

===Vulnerability===
Electric vulnerability increases electric damage taken by +50%.

It can be given as part of [[Qazlal]]'s [[divine retribution|wrath]], but is not found anywhere else. No monsters are vulnerable to electric damage.

==See Also==
[[:Category:Electricity resistance|List of electricity resistant monsters]]

==History==
*Prior to [[0.18]], rElec reduced damage by 75%.
*Prior to [[0.14]], the [[electrocution]] brand would spread electricity through [[shallow water]], dealing damage to nearby creatures standing in water.
*Prior to [[0.13]], being airborne gave immunity to the [[electrocution]] brand and resistance to [[Static Discharge]].

[[Category: Air Magic]]
